verses.roman:
evaṁ svāyambhuvaḥ pautram
anuśāsya manur dhruvam
tenābhivanditaḥ sākam
ṛṣibhiḥ sva-puraṁ yayau

synonyms: evam—thus; svāyambhuvaḥ—Lord Svāyambhuva Manu; pautram—to his grandson; anuśāsya—after giving instruction; manuḥ—Lord Manu; dhruvam—to Dhruva Mahārāja; tena—by him; abhivanditaḥ—being offered obeisances to; sākam—together; ṛṣibhiḥ—with the sages; sva-puram—to his own abode; yayau—went.
translation: Thus Svāyambhuva Manu, after giving instruction to Dhruva Mahārāja, his grandson, received respectful obeisances from him. Then Lord Manu and the great sages went back to their respective homes.
